reviewText: A movie that looks like it cost $200M to make you feel politely sad. I respected it more than I enjoyed it.
Prestige, but at least it’s competent prestige. A few scenes genuinely hit. The rest are ‘please clap’.
It’s ridiculous and it knows it. That’s half the battle. The hat deserves its own agent.
Two hours of feelings is fine. Two hours of the same feeling is a hostage situation.
This is the kind of film that wins awards for being sad in a historically accurate way. I was moved, then immediately hungry.
I liked it, but it also felt like homework that someone else’s rich parents paid for.
A quiet movie that actually earns quiet. Great pacing. Zero melodrama. I respect the restraint.
Funny enough to justify the trauma. Not a masterpiece, but at least it remembered to be a movie.
Funny enough to justify the trauma. Not a masterpiece, but at least it remembered to be a movie.
Good effects, but I don't really like the blue people stuff too much.
Amazing time. Top 5 of all time. I loved the honey bit.
